Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; on exterior of rim ivy wreath between black bands; black-figure frieze on top of rim: from far left, at edge of handle plate, part of palmette with volute; lion with added red on mane, to right with left front paw raised confronting boar with red on neck; at right, feline hindquarters, to right.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Athens, Agora P 25273 in Agora XXIII, no. 476; for animals on top of the rim, see 161.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.34)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0165) (Phase 1)
